name: My 100th Quiz-The Best of Entertainment | Entertainment | 15 Questions

questions.text: "Taxi"-The Song: What is the name of the taxi driver in this Harry Chapin song?
questions.explanation:
Harry.

	Harry Chapin was born in Greenwich Village, New York on December 7, 1942.

questions.text: "To Kill a Mockingbird":  Who was the character Dill based on?
questions.explanation:
Truman Capote.

	Truman Capote was a childhood friend of Harper Lee, the author of "To Kill a Mockingbird".

questions.text: A Quiz On Charlie Brown:  What is the name of Charlie Brown's sister?
questions.explanation:
Sally.

	Kathy (or sometimes credited as Cathy) Steinberg was the voice of Sally in "A Charlie Brown Christmas" and "It's a Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown."

questions.text: "The Beverly Hillbillies"-The TV Series: What did the Clampett's use for a dining room table?
questions.explanation:
Pool Table.

	The show was cancelled in 1971 because of CBS's desire to erase its "Rural Network" image.  Other shows fitting this image that were also cancelled were "Green Acres" and "Petticoat Junction."

questions.text: How Well Do You Know Your TV Theme Songs: What show's theme song was "Suicide is Painless"?
questions.explanation:
M*A*S*H.

	"Suicide is Painless" was written for the movie version of "M*A*S*H" and originally contained lyrics but the lyrics were dropped for the TV version.  The song was written by Johnny Mandel (music) and Mike Altman (lyrics).

questions.text: Hitchcock's "The Birds": What is unusual about this movie?
options: Hitchcock didn't appear somewhere in the movie
It was based on a true story
questions.explanation:
No musical score.

	"The Birds" was based on a story by Daphne DuMaurier.  Hitchcock is seen walking two dogs in the his cameo in the movie.

questions.text: Who Did The Voices- "Antz": Who did the voice of 'Z'?
questions.explanation:
Woody Allen.

	Woody Allen recorded all his lines in just five days.

questions.text: Songs From Movies:  Who sang the song "How Do I Live" from the movie "Con Air"?
questions.explanation:
Trisha Yearwood.

	Rimes was originally set to sing the song, but the producers didn't think she was mature enough to sing the song, so they replaced her with Trisha Yearwood.

questions.text: "The Rookie": What was the title character's name?
questions.explanation:
Jim Morris.

	Jim Morris was portrayed by Dennis Quaid and told the real life story of a 35 year old teacher making his Major League pitching debut. He pitched a total of 15 innings in 21 appearances during his two years in the Major Leagues.  He ended up with no win, losses, or saves and ended his career with an ERA of 4.80.

questions.text: "I Love Lucy" Trivia: What was Lucy arrested for in Paris?
options: Wearing a potato sack for a dress
questions.explanation:
Counterfeit money.

	This is the episode where Lucy goes to the Cafe and orders Escargot, and asked for Ketchup to put on them and that makes the Chef upset and she pays with the counterfeit money.  At the police station, all questions are translated from French to German to Spanish to English and then the answers was tranlated the other way.

questions.text: 80's Music: According to Billboard, what was the number 1 song in the United States for the decade of the 1980's?
questions.explanation:
Physical.

	"Physical" was Olivia Newton-John's biggest chart hit and spent 10 weeks at number 1.

questions.text: "Bonnie and Clyde"-The Movie: Who played Bonnie Parker?
questions.explanation:
Faye Dunaway.

	Jane Fonda was offered the role, but turned it down because she was living in Paris at the time and did not want to move back to the U.S.

questions.text: TV Sitcoms: What high school did Al Bundy attend on "Married With Children"?
questions.explanation:
Polk.

	Al loves to tell the story of when he scored four touchdowns, while at Polk High.

questions.text: Another Country Music Quiz: What was the profession of Tim McGraw's father?
questions.explanation:
Professional baseball player.

	Tim's father is Tug McGraw who played baseball for the New York Mets and Philadelphia Phillies.

questions.text: Match the Quote and Movie: What movie is this line from, "I've been kidnapped by K-Mart"?
options: Down and Out in Beverly Hills
questions.explanation:
Ruthless People.

	The line was said by Bette Midler.  Other stars of "Ruthless People" are Judge Reinhold and Danny Devito.
